meanings.definition: Unable to be passed or crossed
meanings.sent1: The deep, fast river was impassable for the small boat.
meanings.sent2: The fallen tree made the path impassable for hikers.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the closed door impassable and meowed for help.
meanings.sent4: The language barrier between them made communication impassable.
meanings.sent5: The towering mountain was an impassable obstacle for the climbers.

meanings.sent1: The thick fog created an impassable view for the drivers.
meanings.sent2: The security guard declared the area impassable to unauthorized personnel.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar lid seemed impassable until she used a jar opener.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules made the task feel impassable to the new employees.
meanings.sent5: The closed gate was an impassable barrier for the curious children.
